content: Section 13 of the text outlines the relationship of the current Act to other laws. It specifies that nothing in the Act is meant to affect other laws, regulations, or authorities, except as expressly provided. The Act also provides that the President or the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) can still exercise any authority under the Defense Production Act of 1950, and that the Secretary cannot review a transaction involving the acquisition of an information and communications technology product or service by a United States person if it is authorized under a United States government-industrial security program or for meeting a national security or law enforcement requirement.
